column1: 4057793509,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-decskill-4057793509?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=GOa%2BYaOi3JuQOEx%2B%2FHu61g%3D%3D&trackingId=u0hXGrsPsrQhh2R%2FdzT8FQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Decskill,Porto Metropolitan Area,"Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:

Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.

At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.
We are looking for a Data Analyst for a hybrid project based in Porto (2x/Week).
Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis and visualization
Create and adapt data analysis models and tools
Mount, execute and automate ETL processes for extracting data (with Python and SQL) to serve analytical needs
Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our in-house models
Basic knowledge of data python packages
If you’re interested in this job please send your CV to carolina.novais@decskill.com with reference CN/DAP.

Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

3981451704,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-hybrid-%40porto-at-kcs-it-3981451704?position=8&pageNum=0&refId=GOa%2BYaOi3JuQOEx%2B%2FHu61g%3D%3D&trackingId=F1mHXJHV%2Bm%2B29mS9Q%2Bd6Ug%3D%3D,Data Analyst (HYBRID @Porto),KCS iT,"Porto, Portugal","We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!
We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst
Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week in Porto)
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Statistics or Mathematics
3+ years of experience as Data Analyst
Proficiency with ETL, SQL, PowerBI and Alteryx
Experience with Jaspersoft, VBA, API, Python and Tibco Spotfire are nice to have
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto (Portugal)
To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you´ll have (plus):
Why should you become part of our family?
You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!


We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst

Seniority: +3 years

Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week in Porto)


The amazing you, will have:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Statistics or Mathematics
column2: • 3+ years of experience as Data Analyst
column4: • Experience with Jaspersoft, VBA, API, Python and Tibco Spotfire are nice to have
column8: • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
column10:
• Fluency in English is mandatory.



    • To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you´ll have (plus):

    • Comfort speaking French.


    Why should you become part of our family?

    • You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
    • Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
    • Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
    • International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
    • Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
    • In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
    • Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
    • Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
    • Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!


    Who are we?

    Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

4038021207,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-efacec-4038021207?position=9&pageNum=0&refId=GOa%2BYaOi3JuQOEx%2B%2FHu61g%3D%3D&trackingId=qm%2BR%2Bmedg9YtWpvkV5he8w%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Analyst,Efacec,"São Mamede de Infesta, Porto, Portugal","Como imaginas o futuro?
O nosso propósito é criar um futuro mais inteligente para uma vida melhor.
Contamos contigo para te juntares a nós e ajudares a construir um mundo melhor para as gerações futuras.

A Efacec é uma empresa com 75 anos de história a inovar pelo mundo que partilhamos, atuando em setores estruturantes para a sociedade e de reconhecida importância em todas as geografias em que está presente, promovendo a mudança e impactando positivamente milhões de pessoas.
Em Portugal, estamos nos polos da Arroteia (sede), Maia e Oeiras, tendo ainda uma pegada global com presença em 13 países e vendas em mais de 86 países.
Estamos à procura de um(a) IT Consultant para reforçar a equipa de Sistemas de Informação, localizada no Polo da Arroteia, Matosinhos.
Interagir com os utilizadores, recolher requisitos, desenvolver especificações, desenvolver e testar programas
Trabalhar de forma eficaz com membros de equipas multifuncionais e utilizadores
Tarefas relacionadas com a manutenção do sistema e tempo de atividade (aplicação de patches, testes)
Assumir a responsabilidade pela solução e encerramento de pedidos de suporte no helpdesk para a base de utilizadores a nível mundial
Documentar alterações de acordo com as melhores práticas para garantir uma gestão de conhecimento bem-sucedida.
Formação em Ciências da Computação ou experiência de trabalho equivalente
Mínimo de 3 anos de desenvolvimento em SQL utilizando Microsoft SQL Server, procedimentos armazenados, design e otimização de bases de dados
Mínimo de 3 anos de desenvolvimento em SQL com SSIS, SSRS e SSAS
Mínimo de 3 anos de desenvolvimento com PowerBI
Conhecimento intermediário de MS Excel, SharePoint e PowerPlatform (PowerApps, Automate) é uma vantagem
Domínio da língua Inglesa (falada e escrita)
Orientação para a mudança e inovação.
Possibilidade de integrar um grupo empresarial de referência com forte presença internacional
Possibilidade de aprendizagem e capacitação num regime de “learning by doing”
Acesso a formação através da nossa Mast3r Academia (Academia de formação interna) e de instituições de ensino
Acesso permanente aos nossos serviços médicos e de enfermagem
Acesso a protocolos e parcerias estratégicas
Possibilidade de trabalhar num regime híbrido (presencial/remoto).

Como imaginas o futuro?

O nosso propósito é criar um futuro mais inteligente para uma vida melhor.

Contamos contigo para te juntares a nós e ajudares a construir um mundo melhor para as gerações futuras.

Quem somos:

A Efacec é uma empresa com 75 anos de história a inovar pelo mundo que partilhamos, atuando em setores estruturantes para a sociedade e de reconhecida importância em todas as geografias em que está presente, promovendo a mudança e impactando positivamente milhões de pessoas.

Em Portugal, estamos nos polos da Arroteia (sede), Maia e Oeiras, tendo ainda uma pegada global com presença em 13 países e vendas em mais de 86 países.

O que procuramos:

Estamos à procura de um(a) IT Consultant para reforçar a equipa de Sistemas de Informação, localizada no Polo da Arroteia, Matosinhos.

Missão:

  • Customizações, design e codificação
column2: • Interagir com os utilizadores, recolher requisitos, desenvolver especificações, desenvolver e testar programas
column3: • Trabalhar de forma eficaz com membros de equipas multifuncionais e utilizadores
column4: • Tarefas relacionadas com a manutenção do sistema e tempo de atividade (aplicação de patches, testes)

column9: • Mínimo de 3 anos de desenvolvimento com PowerBI
column10: • Conhecimento intermediário de MS Excel, SharePoint e PowerPlatform (PowerApps, Automate) é uma vantagem

• Orientação para a mudança e inovação.


    • O que oferecemos:

    • Possibilidade de integrar um grupo empresarial de referência com forte presença internacional
column17: • Possibilidade de aprendizagem e capacitação num regime de “learning by doing”
column18: • Acesso a formação através da nossa Mast3r Academia (Academia de formação interna) e de instituições de ensino
column19: • Acesso permanente aos nossos serviços médicos e de enfermagem

🚀 Ready to join us, Data Analyst?
A nossa visão consiste em inovar e reinventar através de serviços tecnológicos, promovendo o sucesso dos nossos parceiros.
A nossa missão é conectar clientes a profissionais altamente especializados e impulsionar negócios.
A nossa cultura é centrada nas pessoas e no seu bem-estar, o que nos permite atrair e reter o melhor de talento.
Junta-te à equipa Ytech! Envia o teu CV para vmaia@ytech.io

4059201743,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-axians-portugal-4059201743?position=16&pageNum=0&refId=GOa%2BYaOi3JuQOEx%2B%2FHu61g%3D%3D&trackingId=GPXMbC0gWwQ8UHlJsmc%2BmA%3D%3D,Data analyst,Axians Portugal,"Porto, Porto, Portugal","At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. It is also part of our culture to care about the environment and to carry out actions of social and environmental corporate responsibility.
This could be your opportunity to join a project of international scope, with a client that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.
We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Analyst for an international project in the banks sector.
Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis and visualization
Create and adapt data analysis models and tools
Mount, execute and automate ETL processes for extracting data (with python and SQL) to serve analytical needs
Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our in-house models
Basic knowledge of data python packages
At least 3 years of working experience
Client focused with high customer care
Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and manage changing priorities
Autonomous, proactive, rigorous with a high personal commitment
⭐ What You Can Expect From Us
Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.
You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360° evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.
Reconciliation of professional and family life
By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

When working with Axians customers, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.
Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with subject DA.AS.MO

At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. It is also part of our culture to care about the environment and to carry out actions of social and environmental corporate responsibility.

This could be your opportunity to join a project of international scope, with a client that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

💻 THE JOB

  • Create and update PowerBI Dashboards
  • Collect data (internal &

external) and investigate their business value through data analysis and visualization

improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses

4056696703,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/people-analytics-at-h%C3%B4ma-4056696703?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=GOa%2BYaOi3JuQOEx%2B%2FHu61g%3D%3D&trackingId=Lt9jDHKxiZluo%2BEjq00RGA%3D%3D,People Analytics,hôma,"Vila Nova de Gaia, Porto, Portugal","Na hôma, acreditamos que o bem-estar e o desenvolvimento dos nossos colaboradores são a chave para o nosso sucesso e, por isso, levamos o conceito de happy work living muito a sério. Estamos à procura de alguém como tu, que valoriza dados e análise, que quer fazer a diferença no acompanhamento de métricas e tendências de recursos humanos, e que tenha paixão por melhorar continuamente as práticas do nosso departamento de Pessoas e Cultura.
Procuramos um People Analytics para se juntar a nós nesta jornada de construção de uma cultura centrada no bem-estar e na inovação.

Missão: Assegurar a implementação de soluções e análises de dados para apoiar a tomada de decisão estratégica no departamento de Pessoas e Cultura, promovendo insights que contribuam para a competitividade e sustentabilidade do negócio.
O que será o teu dia-a-dia de trabalho...
Recolher e analisar dados de recursos humanos (tais como retenção, absentismo, desempenho)
Desenvolver e gerir relatórios e dashboards que permitam verificar tendências, riscos e oportunidades de melhoria
Apoiar na definição e acompanhamento de KPIs de performance relacionados à gestão de talento, envolvimento e cultura organizacional
Colaborar com outras áreas para garantir a integração de dados e análise de diferentes fontes
Criar modelos preditivos e análises avançadas para identificar padrões de comportamento e prever necessidades futuras de gestão de pessoas
Auxiliar na identificação de estratégias de recrutamento e desenvolvimento de talento, usando dados para melhorar a eficácia dos processos
Apoiar a implementação de novas ferramentas e metodologias de análise de dados, promovendo a inovação contínua no departamento.
O que vamos valorizar no teu perfil...
Formação académica em Estatística, Gestão, Recursos Humanos ou área similar
Domínio avançado de Excel e ferramentas de análise de dados (Power BI, Tableau)
Conhecimentos em linguagens de programação como SQL ou Python (preferencial)
Disponibilidade para estágio profissional IEFP (preferencial, mas não mandatório)
Espírito crítico e forte capacidade analítica
Proatividade para sugerir melhorias e novas abordagens com base nas análises feitas.

Na nossa equipa, acreditamos que cada análise traz uma nova oportunidade de melhoria e evolução. Junta-te a nós e ajuda-nos a transformar dados em ações para um futuro melhor! Juntos pelo #happyworkliving

Na hôma, acreditamos que o bem-estar e o desenvolvimento dos nossos colaboradores são a chave para o nosso sucesso e, por isso, levamos o conceito de happy work living muito a sério. Estamos à procura de alguém como tu, que valoriza dados e análise, que quer fazer a diferença no acompanhamento de métricas e tendências de recursos humanos, e que tenha paixão por melhorar continuamente as práticas do nosso departamento de Pessoas e Cultura.

Procuramos um People Analytics para se juntar a nós nesta jornada de construção de uma cultura centrada no bem-estar e na inovação.

Missão: Assegurar a implementação de soluções e análises de dados para apoiar a tomada de decisão estratégica no departamento de Pessoas e Cultura, promovendo insights que contribuam para a competitividade e sustentabilidade do negócio.

O que será o teu dia-a-dia de trabalho...

  • Recolher e analisar dados de recursos humanos (tais como retenção, absentismo, desempenho)

column3: • Apoiar na definição e acompanhamento de KPIs de performance relacionados à gestão de talento, envolvimento e cultura organizacional

4033274442,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/lead-data-analyst-cloud-technologies-at-sogrape-4033274442?position=37&pageNum=0&refId=GOa%2BYaOi3JuQOEx%2B%2FHu61g%3D%3D&trackingId=9lYVkabhpwGPuEEryYHCEA%3D%3D,Lead Data Analyst (Cloud Technologies),SOGRAPE,"Vila Nova de Gaia, Porto, Portugal","At Sogrape, we are embarking on a transformative data journey, and we are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our team. Be part of our data transformation journey as the Cloud Data Platform Lead Analyst. You will oversee the implementation of a cloud-based data platform analytic solutions, from design to deployment. Your role will involve architecting scalable solutions, integrating diverse datasets, and execute reporting for the organisation.

In this role, as Lead data analyst, you will engage with business stakeholders to discuss their requirements, implement challenging analytic solutions, and ensure comprehensive reporting across the organization. You will be responsible for upholding data governance and quality, shaping our organization's data infrastructure to drive valuable insights.

If you are skilled in cloud technologies and passionate about data-driven solutions, join us in this impactful project. Apply now and become a catalyst in our organization's data transformation journey.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs and provide data-driven solutions

You will be responsible for developing comprehensive analytic solutions tailored to business requirements and ensuring that organizational reporting meets the highest standards of accuracy and relevance
Ensure data quality and governance by implementing and maintaining data standards, policies, and procedures
Collect, clean and analyze data from various sources, including Google Cloud Platform or others, to provide actionable insights
Build and maintain reports and dashboards in Power BI to support business decision-making
Provide training and support to business users, empowering them to effectively interact with data visualizations and accurately interpret results
Stay updated with the latest advancements in cloud technologies and data reporting practices, continuously improving our business intelligence platform
Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field
Minimum of 2 years of proven experience as a Data Analyst, with a focus on building reporting and analysis for business
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms and services, such as Azure (Data Factory, Power BI, SQL) and Google Cloud (BigQuery)

Possess strong analytical skills and a solid understanding of data modelling, particularly within cloud data architectures. Ensure adherence to data quality and governance principles for implementing analytic solutions tailored to business needs
Proficient in structured query languages (SQL) and programming languages such as Python, PySpark
Strong communication and collaboration skills, enabling you to work closely with business stakeholders to translate their requirements into data and reporting needs
Experience in providing training and support to business users on data visualizations and interpretation
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
Work with a specialized team in a global family wine company with a strong international presence in more than 120 markets
Hybrid working model and additional vacation days
Exclusive access to our top-quality wines and great brands
Exclusive access to wine tourism experiences at our properties
Specialized wine training at the Sogrape Wine Academy
Health Insurance, Sogrape Pension Plan, Flexible Benefits Plan, and wellness initiatives
Apply now to be part of our exciting journey!

At Sogrape, we are embarking on a transformative data journey, and we are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our team. Be part of our data transformation journey as the Cloud Data Platform Lead Analyst. You will oversee the implementation of a cloud-based data platform analytic solutions, from design to deployment. Your role will involve architecting scalable solutions, integrating diverse datasets, and execute reporting for the organisation.


In this role, as Lead data analyst, you will engage with business stakeholders to discuss their requirements, implement challenging analytic solutions, and ensure comprehensive reporting across the organization. You will be responsible for upholding data governance and quality, shaping our organization's data infrastructure to drive valuable insights.


If you are skilled in cloud technologies and passionate about data-driven solutions, join us in this impactful project. Apply now and become a catalyst in our organization's data transformation journey.


Your main responsibilities:

  • Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs and provide data-driven solutions
  • You will be responsible for developing comprehensive analytic solutions tailored to business requirements and ensuring that organizational reporting meets the highest standards of accuracy and relevance
  • Ensure data quality and governance by implementing and maintaining data standards, policies, and procedures
  • Collect, clean and analyze data from various sources, including Google Cloud Platform or others, to provide actionable insights
  • Build and maintain reports and dashboards in Power BI to support business decision-making
  • Provide training and support to business users, empowering them to effectively interact with data visualizations and accurately interpret results
  • Stay updated with the latest advancements in cloud technologies and data reporting practices, continuously improving our business intelligence platform


What we are looking for:

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field
  • Minimum of 2 years of proven experience as a Data Analyst, with a focus on building reporting and analysis for business
  • Hands-on experience with cloud platforms and services, such as Azure (Data Factory, Power BI, SQL) and Google Cloud (BigQuery)
  • Possess strong analytical skills and a solid understanding of data modelling, particularly within cloud data architectures. Ensure adherence to data quality and governance principles for implementing analytic solutions tailored to business needs
  • Proficient in structured query languages (SQL) and programming languages such as Python, PySpark
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, enabling you to work closely with business stakeholders to translate their requirements into data and reporting needs
  • Experience in providing training and support to business users on data visualizations and interpretation
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment


What we have to offer:

  • Work with a specialized team in a global family wine company with a strong international presence in more than 120 markets
  • Hybrid working model and additional vacation days
  • Exclusive access to our top-quality wines and great brands
  • Exclusive access to wine tourism experiences at our properties
  • Specialized wine training at the Sogrape Wine Academy
  • Health Insurance, Sogrape Pension Plan, Flexible Benefits Plan, and wellness initiatives
  • Professional development opportunities


Apply now to be part of our exciting journey!

4030988314,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/financial-resources-data-analyst-at-bnp-paribas-cib-4030988314?position=38&pageNum=0&refId=GOa%2BYaOi3JuQOEx%2B%2FHu61g%3D%3D&trackingId=WY3QRRh7%2BfCZvDN3mnLBiQ%3D%3D,Financial Resources Data Analyst,BNP Paribas CIB,"Porto, Porto, Portugal","About The Job

The Financial Resources Data Analyst plays an important and accountable role in providing support on the management of Global Markets Resources, namely Liquidity, Balance Sheet and Capital and the monitoring of future regulations.
The Financial Resources Data Analyst measures, allocates and optimizes Resources to ensure that the operational entity grows revenue, market share, and profitability in a sustainable way.
Collect, Prepare, consolidate data and Monitoring and keep track of Gaps on Global Markets Resources.
Responsible for database production and maintenance.
Assist on the preparation of presentations on topics related to Global Market resources.
Provides assistance to incoming requests from different regulators.
Responsible for producing GM Resources metrics, following a continuous improvement mindset (acquiring and building knowledge on the different business Lines, units and organization).
Develop knowledge on technical skills and apply those in order to efficiently perform the tasks.
Build knowledge and understanding on the 5 main types for Global markets and Help monitor those - Credit
Build knowledge and easiness in the main tools and software used by the team.
Bachelors/MSc in Economics, Finance and Accounting
Analytical ability, attention to details, autonomy
Technical skills – R, VBA and Python

About The Job

The Financial Resources Data Analyst plays an important and accountable role in providing support on the management of Global Markets Resources, namely Liquidity, Balance Sheet and Capital and the monitoring of future regulations.

The Financial Resources Data Analyst measures, allocates and optimizes Resources to ensure that the operational entity grows revenue, market share, and profitability in a sustainable way.

Your Main Activities Are

  • Collect, Prepare, consolidate data and Monitoring and keep track of Gaps on Global Markets Resources.
  • Responsible for database production and maintenance.
  • Assist on the preparation of presentations on topics related to Global Market resources.
  • Provides assistance to incoming requests from different regulators.
  • Responsible for producing GM Resources metrics, following a continuous improvement mindset (acquiring and building knowledge on the different business Lines, units and organization).
  • Develop knowledge on technical skills and apply those in order to efficiently perform the tasks.
  • Build knowledge and understanding on the 5 main types for Global markets and Help monitor those - Credit
column5:
Operational.
  • Build knowledge and easiness in the main tools and software used by the team.

    • Profile And Skills To Success

    • Bachelors/MSc in Economics, Finance and Accounting
    • Very good communication skills
    • Analytical ability, attention to details, autonomy
    • Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
    • Proactivity
    • Risk management - Risk analysis
    • Technical skills – R, VBA and Python

4055953176,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-data-analyst-fraud-prevention-at-teya-4055953176?position=43&pageNum=0&refId=GOa%2BYaOi3JuQOEx%2B%2FHu61g%3D%3D&trackingId=QnxiK7ORn6PM1OCdLGA18A%3D%3D,Senior Data Analyst - Fraud Prevention,Teya,"Porto, Portugal","Company Description

Teya exists to make sure that every small and growing business in Europe has the opportunity to thrive. We want to become Europe’s go-to software solution for these businesses, simplifying their every day and helping them reconnect with the joy of running their business. Teya was born in 2019 and is home to over 1,000 employees in 15+ countries. We've built a fast-paced, energetic, and innovative environment that is dedicated to bringing the best solutions to customers.

You will be a part of a joint team of machine learning engineers and data scientists building and evolving ML models, real time systems, reports, and deep analysis of fraud detection and mitigation activities to protect merchants, their customers, and Teya from fraudulent activities.

Working with advanced predictive models and scalable software systems, build and grow intelligent solutions to reduce all kinds of risk and allow Teya to focus on effectively serving our merchants. Key individual contributor for a diverse and innovative team to create deep understanding of big data inputs and contribute to continuous improvement while addressing fast-moving risks and opportunities.

Working with senior product, business, and engineering leaders to analyze data, identify opportunities for building new models, build and maintain real time dashboards, and deliver insights through in-depth reports. Collaborate with your peers across Teya to share insights and enable real-time decision making wherever opportunity arises.
As a Senior Data Analyst on the Fraud Prevention team you will:
Lead with data to design, develop, and implement solutions for Fraud Prevention
Collect, store, and analyse large data sets
Integrate data into business processes and systems
Write complex SQL queries and scripts
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, ML engineers, product managers, and business analysts
Build and maintain dashboards and reports in a variety of environments including Snowflake and Tableau
Effectively manage business stakeholders and drive initiatives to promote actionable insights, identifying and prioritising requirements and owning a roadmap of deliverables
Analyse external customer and internal business data working with teams across different countries to drive optimisation of our products
Build predictive models to accurately forecast our numbers and evaluate against the budget and actuals.
Promote a data-driven culture across the business
5+ years of professional data analyst experience in a technical domain
Highly proficient in SQL and Tableau (or equivalent BI tool)
Self-starter, comfortable in a fast-paced environment and able to adapt to changing circumstances quickly
Capable of translating complex data into understandable conclusions and recommendations
Ability to think creatively and insightfully about business problems
Good written and verbal communication skills
Experience with Machine Learning and Python (time-series analysis, forecasting)
Familiarity with AWS environment (SageMaker, S3, Redshift)
Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, or relevant experience in related field
We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team
25 days of Annual leave (+ Bank holidays)
Frequent team events & activities in the office and outside
Friendly, comfortable and informal office environment.

Company Description

Teya exists to make sure that every small and growing business in Europe has the opportunity to thrive. We want to become Europe’s go-to software solution for these businesses, simplifying their every day and helping them reconnect with the joy of running their business. Teya was born in 2019 and is home to over 1,000 employees in 15+ countries. We've built a fast-paced, energetic, and innovative environment that is dedicated to bringing the best solutions to customers.

Job Description

Your Mission

You will be a part of a joint team of machine learning engineers and data scientists building and evolving ML models, real time systems, reports, and deep analysis of fraud detection and mitigation activities to protect merchants, their customers, and Teya from fraudulent activities.

Working with advanced predictive models and scalable software systems, build and grow intelligent solutions to reduce all kinds of risk and allow Teya to focus on effectively serving our merchants. Key individual contributor for a diverse and innovative team to create deep understanding of big data inputs and contribute to continuous improvement while addressing fast-moving risks and opportunities.

Working with senior product, business, and engineering leaders to analyze data, identify opportunities for building new models, build and maintain real time dashboards, and deliver insights through in-depth reports. Collaborate with your peers across Teya to share insights and enable real-time decision making wherever opportunity arises.

As a Senior Data Analyst on the Fraud Prevention team you will:

  • Lead with data to design, develop, and implement solutions for Fraud Prevention
column2: • Collect, store, and analyse large data sets
column3: • Integrate data into business processes and systems
column5: • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, ML engineers, product managers, and business analysts
column6: • Build and maintain dashboards and reports in a variety of environments including Snowflake and Tableau
column7: • Effectively manage business stakeholders and drive initiatives to promote actionable insights, identifying and prioritising requirements and owning a roadmap of deliverables
column8: • Analyse external customer and internal business data working with teams across different countries to drive optimisation of our products
column9:
• Build predictive models to accurately forecast our numbers and evaluate against the budget and actuals.
  • Promote a data-driven culture across the business

    • Qualifications

    Your Story

    Basic Requirements

    • 5+ years of professional data analyst experience in a technical domain
    • Highly proficient in SQL and Tableau (or equivalent BI tool)
    • Good analytical and problem-solving skills
    • Self-starter, comfortable in a fast-paced environment and able to adapt to changing circumstances quickly
    • Capable of translating complex data into understandable conclusions and recommendations
    • Ability to think creatively and insightfully about business problems
    • Good written and verbal communication skills

    Preferred Requirements

    • Experience with Machine Learning and Python (time-series analysis, forecasting)
    • Familiarity with AWS environment (SageMaker, S3, Redshift)
    • Familiarity with Snowflake
    • Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, or relevant experience in related field

    Additional Information

    The Perks

    • We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team

4058980170,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-ai-security-analyst-at-accenture-portugal-4058980170?position=51&pageNum=0&refId=GOa%2BYaOi3JuQOEx%2B%2FHu61g%3D%3D&trackingId=GVX%2BERMSocWSe%2FvulDQ2eQ%3D%3D,Data & AI Security Analyst,Accenture Portugal,"Porto, Portugal","Job Summary

We are seeking a skilled and passionate Data & AI Security Professional to join our team. As a Data & AI Security Professional, you will play a crucial role in developing and implementing innovative Data & AI-driven solutions to address complex business challenges. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to collect, analyze, and interpret data to drive actionable insights and enhance decision-making processes.
You provide technical leadership as we design and deploy secure Data&AI architectures for on premises and cloud solutions.
Leading workshops on the key Data & AI security challenges of our clients.
Experience in preparing system security reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data and trends for project and operational and project governance reporting.
Strong analytical skills to solve technical issues and flexibility in handling multiple issues at once.
Partnering with our clients to find the best Data & AI security solutions.
Driven cyber security professional with a passion for information security.
A Bachelor’s degree, preferably related to Business IT or Security, such as Business Informatics, Computer Security, Data Science or equivalent.
Basic understanding of Cybersecurity and at least one of the fundamental areas of Data Security: Discovery and Classification or Data Encryption.
Knowledge in programming languages such as Python, R, Scala or related.
Understanding of data structures, algorithms, and statistics.
Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills in addition to strong attention to detail.
Strong collaboration skills, ideally working with global and multi-functional teams.
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.
Cloud Security (Azure AZ-900, AZ-500 and AWS Security an advantage)
Data Security related vendor certification(s). (Microsoft, Thales, SailPoint)
Knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.

We are seeking a skilled and passionate Data &

  • Understanding of data structures, algorithms, and statistics.

  • Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills in addition to strong attention to detail.

  • Strong collaboration skills, ideally working with global and multi-functional teams.

  • Fluent in English.

  • Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.


    • Preferred Qualifications


  • Cloud Security (Azure AZ-900, AZ-500 and AWS Security an advantage)

  • Data Security related vendor certification(s). (Microsoft, Thales, SailPoint)

  • Knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.

4061755236,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/lead-insight-analyst-at-vml-4061755236?position=59&pageNum=0&refId=GOa%2BYaOi3JuQOEx%2B%2FHu61g%3D%3D&trackingId=nNJRk8yySYXOHPzPdg7VFg%3D%3D,Lead Insight Analyst,VML,"Porto, Porto, Portugal","Who We Are: At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.
Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work.
Lead Insight Analyst required to joining our rapidly expanding Data Analytics team on a permanent basis. The opportunity:

As a Lead Insight Analyst you will have the opportunity to work on some of our largest projects and key accounts. Reporting to the Head of Data Analytics, you will be responsible for analysing digital behaviour in order to provide key, actionable insight and critical recommendations to our clients. This is more than just an insight role
column2: it’s an opportunity to help shape the digital strategies of some of the world’s leading brands and retailers! You will be tool agnostic and you will use tools like Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics for tracking data, GTM, Adobe Launch or Tealium for implementing tags and a mixture of data visualization tool as well as Excel and Powerpoint for visualisation. Additionally, you will be managing a small team of Analysts and will be providing oversight to ensure that their delivering tool quality analysis outputs.

column1: Please note that this job is a full-time position located in Lisbon or Porto, but the selection process will be conducted in English.
Please send over your CV in English What you’ll be doing: Shaping, sell and deliver large analytics programs of work.
Creating measurement plans that identify the customer behaviour to be tracked (you will work closely with our implementation analysts for this)
Establishing detailed reporting and visualisations that help our clients understand the performance of their digital channels
Using measurement tools to analyse digital user behaviours in detail, across a wide range of digital properties (websites, mobile applications, instore devices)
Creating detailed insight reports that cover key findings and recommendations
Presenting your findings to a senior-level client audience and helping them understand what it means for their business
Working with our internal UX and design teams to inform the creation of new websites and apps
Answering client queries and running training sessions with them
Having line management duties for a small team of analysts, including developing their skillset and driving the quality of their work
What we want from you: Extensive experience working as a Lead Analyst providing insight, ideally in an ecommerce setting (client or agency)
Must have Advanced practical knowledge of Analytics tools (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Content Square)
Numerically adept in using Excel (or similar) to analyse data
Previous experience supporting junior team members
Highly proficient in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint
Extensive experience working with senior client stakeholders
Effective time management and multitasking abilities
A proven track record of delivering large insight projects for leading B2C organisations

What we can offer you: Alongside the opportunity to work with some of the most exciting brands around the world, we’ll also prioritise your career development and help you grow your skills. We’ll empower you to make a difference, allow you to be yourself, and respect who you are. We offer a great benefits package including hybrid working that works for everyone, social events, training opportunities, medical and dental insurance, life assurance, meal cards and much more. Our personality and behaviours: We believe that we are what we do, not just what we say. Our shared values and behaviours show how to bring the VML Enterprise Solution's culture to life through the actions we all take every day: Connect Meaningfully Inspire Creatively Include Purposefully Approach Positively Our brilliant, talented people are what makes VML Enterprise Solutions what we are. That’s why we look for people who go beyond and always push our thinking to be better than yesterday. AT VML Enterprise Solutions Our Enterprise Solutions division houses strategic consultants, creative and technical architects and skilled developers and operators that together help some of the world’s leading organisations to deliver outstanding digital experiences across all major routes to market worldwide: marketplaces, online retailers, D2C, B2B and social platforms. With over 4,200 experts in 55 operational centres across 34 countries, our capabilities span the entire buying journey from customer acquisition, through engagement, to conversion and loyalty, driving multi-channel growth for world-leading brands. We work with some of the most exciting brands such as The Coca-Cola Company, EY, Bosch, Unilever, Ford, DFS, Mercedes-Benz, Johnson & Johnson, Nestlé, Sainsbury’s, Selfridges, Shell and Tiffany & Co. We’ve built over 500 platforms for brands and retailers and generate in excess of $29bn annually for our clients and work with over 50 strategic partners including Adobe, SAP, Salesforce, HCL, Shopify, Sitecore, BigCommerce, commerce tools and Acquia. Our reputation is based on our people, and we believe we have some of the best in the business. As our business grows internationally, we’re looking for new people to join us on our journey to inspire and take a key role in shaping some of the best commerce solutions, services, and websites in the world. Working as a team, no problem is insurmountable
column2: we share in our client’s successes and believe that anyone can show creative bravery no matter what their role is in the team. In our Lisbon or Porto office, you’ll join a team of other specialists who are always ready to help each other. The team is part of our Enterprise Solutions network and works in coordination with our Local and EMEA client leads.

column1: At VML, we are committed to fostering an all-inclusive work environment that is both rewarding and career-forward. Our Inclusion, Equity & Belonging initiatives, alongside the VML Foundation, reflect our dedication to giving back and making a positive impact in our communities and beyond. Our people are the heartbeat of our organization—creators, doers, innovators, makers, and thinkers—who drive not just marketing, but meaningful experiences that resonate in every action and interaction.
VML is a WPP Agency. For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn, and X.

When you click ""Submit Application"", this will send any information you add below to VML. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.
